lst.name: sentence
lst.str: But diplomats said the philosophical gap between ministers like Kiechle, with his commitment to maintaining traditional rural patterns, and others who see runaway farm spending as unacceptable economically, is likely to prove extremely difficult to bridge.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: European Community (EC) leaders hope to make a new attempt to inject fresh urgency into talks on reforming the bloc's controversial farm policy when EC agriculture ministers meet for a third day of discussions here this morning.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Yesterday, they discussed plans to cut cereals prices by 2.5 pct, and reduce farmers' rights to sell surpluses to EC stores, to cut prices for fruit and vegetables by larger margins, and to impose a tax on EC-produced and imported oilseeds, a proposal which would be likely to sour EC trade relations with the United States.

lst.name: sentence

lst.str: European Community (EC) leaders hope to make a new attempt to inject fresh urgency into talks on reforming the bloc's controversial farm policy when EC agriculture ministers meet for a third day of discussions here this morning.
